sub-events.comment: Process player action p0: Player action type p1: Player action 'target id' data

action.name: Log
action.param: "Player action of type " & Function.Param(0) & " with target " & Function.Param(1) & " is blocked"

sub-events.comment: Process custom event triggered by player activity p0: Custom event name p1: Action 'target id' data to identify storyline where to process event

Process custom not blockable quest event. Called only when: - ui actions in lock is not held already - or code called from quest action processing code injects a quest action in p0: Custom event name p1: Action 'target id' data to identify storyline where to process event
Process action performed by any game actor (Player or Continue for now) p0: Player action type p1: Player action 'target id' data p2: Player action 'name' data

action.name: Execute last player action on current stage
Log
action.param: "Custom player action " & CustomEventName & " was restarted with target id: " & EventTargetId

sub-events.comment: p0: Custom event name p1: Action 'target id' data to identify storyline where to process event

action.name: Log
action.param: "Custom player action " & Function.Param(0) & " with target id: " & Function.Param(1) & " is postponed"

sub-events.comment: XXX theoretically our UI <=> protocol allows to send UI action to any stage. but in practice it is impossible due to - Solid stage changers during UI action execution We set here player.stage to work ok during gameplay playback because stage changers may not trigger intersection with player that is moving by 1 sec position measurements. XXX need to refactor Player.CurrentStage usage. It is not clear now.
